subject: Personal Finance
title: Guilt Spending
description: A short lesson to help you apply Guilt Spending.

hook.text: You miss your child's school play. Next weekend you buy them an expensive toy to compensate.

buildup.text: Guilt spending happens when we use money to make up for emotional shortfalls.

discovery.text: Parents who feel guilty about working long hours spend significantly more on their children.

twist.text: The gifts rarely fix the guilt. It creates a cycle: feel bad, spend, feel better briefly, repeat.

climax.text: Charities use this too. Donation requests spike right after negative news events.

quiz.question: What triggers guilt spending?
options: Using money to compensate for emotional shortcomings
